newsitem.title: THAILAND: General Finance tops stock active list.
newsitem.headline: General Finance tops stock active list.

text.p: General Finance and Securities Plc topped the active stock list on Wednesday afternoon on market speculation that its chief executive would be named a cabinet minister, analysts said.
Traders said General Finance shares were actively traded on reports that the firm's chairman Narongchai Akrasanee would be made deputy finance minister.
About 2.37 million General Finance shares were traded by late on Wednesday. The stock was unchanged at 57 baht at 0915 GMT.

General Finance is one of three successful applicants for new bank licences. But the process for government approval to start a banking business was delayed by the collapse of Banharn Silpa-archa's government in September.

Caretaker defence minister Chavalit Yongchaiyudh on Wednesday was negotiating with political partners on sharing cabinet jobs in his six-party coalition, which controls a majority in the lower House of Representatives after Sunday's general election.
Narongchai is an adviser to caretaker deputy premier Amnuay Viravan, who is widely tipped to be the new finance minister.
Amnuay has said he may recruit Narongchai, probably as a cabinet adviser. Narongchai said on Tuesday he did not expect to be included in the cabinet, but described himself as an insider.
